section.section:
The Exchange shall establish a full-scale fraud, waste, and abuse detection and prevention program designed to:
ensure the Exchange's compliance with federal and State laws for the detection and prevention of fraud, waste, and abuse, including whistleblower and confidentiality protections and federal anti-kickback prohibitions; and
promote transparency, credibility, and trust on the part of the public in the integrity of its operations.

The Exchange:
shall, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, submit its plan for the fraud, waste, and abuse detection and prevention program to the Senate Finance Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee; and
shall allow the committees 60 days for review and comment before establishing the program.

text.section: The Exchange shall keep an accurate accounting of all its activities, expenditures, and receipts.

section.section: On or before December 1 of each year, the Board shall forward to the Secretary, the Governor, and, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, the General Assembly, a report on the activities, expenditures, and receipts of the Exchange.

text.section:
The Board shall cooperate fully with any investigation into the affairs of the Exchange, including making available for examination the records of the Exchange, conducted by:
the Secretary under the Secretary's authority under the Affordable Care Act; and
the Commissioner under the Commissioner's authority to regulate the sale and purchase of insurance in the State.
